body.p:
Carlisle Kentucky
December 14th 1863
To his Excelency
Thos E. Bramlett
Governor of Ky

Your Petitioner Owen Conway would respectfully represent to your Excelency that at the September Term 1861. of the Nicholas Circuit Court, through the influence of some personal enemy, he was Indicted for sellin giving a drink of whiskey to a Slave, and that at the March Term previous he was Indicted for Keeping a tipling house. that he was fined $50. in the one & $60. in the other case, that in each case the Indictments were the work of personal enemies, he would further state that he had the Slave employed when he gave him the whiskey and that the owner of said Slave never complained about it. but will join in this Petition to have the fine remitted; and he further states that if he violated any Law in Keeping a tipling house he was entirely unconscious of it, he would represent to your Excelency that he is a very poor man. that he has a large and helpless family, and that if you will remit the foregoing fines you will confer a favor on an humble fellow citizen and save his wife and little ones from distress,
As the owner of the Slave above refered to I hope your Excelency will remit the fine,
We the undersigned citizens of Nicholas County join in this prayer in requesting your Excelency to remit the foregoing fines. Mr. C. is a poor man, and It will be an act of charity to remit them.

A. W. Blair S.N.C
John Clay LD.NC
W. W. Howard Depty Clerk Nicholas Cir. Court
W. P. Ross
R S Evans Co atty.
Fitch Munger
Elijah West D J N C.
William Dinsmore
John F McMillan
William Spencer
John M. Chevis
J. R. Piper
John W. Campbell

Nicholas Cir Ct
Owen Conway
$50 & $60
Tipling
12th Jany/ 64

Remit the fine for giving to slave $50 except fees & costs
Tho E Bramlette
